description.narrative: Denna insats syftar till att stärka Zimbabwes nationella genomförande av de Globala målen och Agenda 2030, samt att stärka ett enat FN sk One-UN och skapa synergier mellan olika FN organs insatser. Stödet ligger i linje med den pågående FN reformen som riktar sig till att stärka FN och särskilt RC-kontoret (UN Resident Coordinators Office). Insatsen kommer främst fokusera på att RC-kontoret stärker arbete inom sju områden: stärka Zimbabwes nationella utvecklingsplan och genomförandet av Agenda 2030 (sk ZUNDAF); ökad jämställdhet; arbete för konfliktprevention för att säkerhetsställa fred och mänskliga rättigheter; stärka strategisk utvecklings kommunikation och påverkansarbete i form av högnivådialog, ökad transparens och anti-korruptions arbete inom FN och i landet i stort, samt stärkt humanitärt arbete med fokus på resiliensarbete och förbättrat klimat. Stödet går till att stödja två internationella experter och en fond.

The overall objective of the project is to put Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) at the forefront of national development as well as strengthen the One-UN by supporting the UN Resident Coordinator Office (RCO). This is foreseen in seven broad pillars: joint UN support to the Government to prepare and implement the new national development plan; consolidation of the investments towards gender equality; joint UN prevention strategy for sustaining peace and promoting human rights; strategic communication and advocacy for UN values and principles; joint UN support to increase transparency and accountability to fight corruption; strengthening humanitarian-development nexus, including through coordinated Disaster Risk Reduction and Climate Action efforts; and, strengthening sectoral and multi-sectoral coordination across key strategic priority areas to maximize results. The UN Resident Coordinator's Office and the UN country Team are the direct beneficiaries of the project. Indirectly it also benefits the government of Zimbabwe and its population to make sure UN work in a more transparent and coordinated manner to implement Agenda 2030 and the Sustainbale Developemnt Goals.

tag.narrative: 1.1 - By 2030, eradicate extreme poverty for all people everywhere, currently measured as people living on less than $1.25 a day.
1.1 - Senast 2030 avskaffa den extrema fattigdomen för alla människor överallt. Med extrem fattigdom avses för närvarande människor som lever på mindre än 1,25 US-dollar per dag.
17.14 - Enhance policy coherence for sustainable development.
17.14 - Föra en mer samstämmig politik för hållbar utveckling.

17.18 - By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts

17.18 - By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts.

17.19 - By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries

17.19 - By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries.

17.4 - Assist developing countries in attaining long-term debt sustainability through coordinated policies aimed at fostering debt financing, debt relief and debt restructuring, as appropriate, and address the external debt of highly indebted poor countries to reduce debt distress.

17.4 - Bistå utvecklingsländerna att uppnå en långsiktigt hållbar skuldsättning genom en samordnad politik som syftar till att, när så är lämpligt, främja skuldfinansiering, skuldlättnad och skuldomstrukturering samt åtgärda kraftigt skuldtyngda fattiga länders utlandsskuld för att minska skuldbördan.

description.narrative: UN support to the government to prepare and implement the new National Development Plan (NDP)Review of the Transitional Stabilization Programme and budget 2020 preparations.Support the government to prepare the SDG:s progress report.ICT bootcamps and exhibition showcasing project s at the Africa Forum on Sustainable Development.Gender equality Launch of the Spotlight initiative Country Programme against gender based violence.Development of a communications strategy for the Spotlight Initiative.Online knowledge portal on SGBV.Facilitation (with UN Women) facilitation, review and oversight of the gender scorecard and assesment of progress within the UN system on gender mainstreaming and promotion of gender equality (comment: given that Sweden also works with and fund a range of UN partners this is an excellent example of where it would have been very valuable with also some information of the outcome of such assessment of the UN system and partners).Support to Zimbabwe Gender Commission.Support government to meet its reporting obligations on international committments through the Beijing +25 National Review and reporting process.Strengthened capacity of yje Council of Chiefs.Joint UN strategy for peace and human rights Advocacy with government to host the visit of the Special Rapporteur (SR) on Freedom of Assembly and of Association.Launch of Spotlight Initiative.Reveiew of several key laws (Harmonized Marriages Bill, Part III of the Criminal Code Act, Mandatory Sentencing for Rape and Sexual Abuse Bill, Child Justice Bill and Cybercrime Bill).UN Partnership on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (UNPRPD) project.Support to National Peace and Reconciliation Commission (NPRC).Support to Zimbabwe Electoral Commission (ZEC).Joint message from the UN Country Team on the human rights day.Communication and advocacy Celebrating 74th anniversary of the UN by a wek long dialogue and exhibition at the National Arts Gallery.Media profiled selected UN supported development projects.Advancing gender equality through advocacy including dedicating the first quarter if the UN Zimbabwe Newsletter to the UN work on gender equality.Support to the launch of the Zimbabwe chapter of the Women in Africa Initiative.The UN commemorated the International Day of the Girl.Official launch of the 16 days of activism against GBV.Galvanizing climate action.Transparency and accountability to fight corruption Facilitated advocacy on anti-corruption in partnership with Transparency International.Meetings with the Chair and officials of the Zimbabwe Anti-Corruption Commission.Facilitaed discussion on transparency and depolitization of humanitarian aid.Humanitarian-development nexus Development of the humanitarian response plan.Facilitation of visit by senior UN officials including UN Emergency Relief Cordinator and USG for OCHA.Facilitation monthly Humanitarian Country Team meetings.Strengthening sectoral and multi-sectoral coordinationCo-chair (WHO) with Sweden the Health Donor Partners Group.Cohesion Series consultation process within the 2016-2020 ZUNDAF for development of joint programs.ZUNDAF independent evaluation process completed.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
